title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination, collaboration with other organizations, and communication with constituency groups. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will advise on interagency coordination, scientific viewpoints in public health policy decisions, and priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. Members will be appointed by the Secretary from individuals not affiliated with the Federal Government. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include voting members from the scientific community, tick-borne disease voluntary organizations, health care providers, and patient representatives. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include voting members representing diverse scientific perspectives, patient representatives, state and local health departments, and national health organizations. The Secretary will also designate ex officio members. The Secretary designates ex officio members from various Federal agencies to the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee, with the Assistant Secretary for Health as the co-chairperson. The Secretary appoints members to the Committee for 4-year terms, with vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Committee holds public meetings, with the Assistant Secretary for Health as the co-chairperson and a public co-chairperson elected by appointed members for a 2-year term. Members may serve after their terms expire until successors take office. The Committee holds public meetings at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. Agenda items can be added at the request of members, and meetings are conducted according to applicable laws and regulations. The Committee must submit a report annually through the Directors of the CDC and NIH. The Committee, overseen by the Directors of the CDC and NIH, must submit an annual report to the Secretary. The report includes the Committee's functions, members, activities, recommendations, and any significant issues. $250,000 is authorized for each fiscal year for the Committee's expenses. Amounts made available for this Act will be used for Committee expenses and per diem costs in accordance with the Federal Advisory Committee Act, with the exception that no voting member can be a permanent salaried employee.
